data.title: Craven's Part in The Great War
data.meta_description: The Soldier Record for Walter TURNER | Craven's Part in The Great War - Remembering the men and women from the Craven district who gave their lives in the First World War
data.text:
Main CPGW Record

Surname: TURNER

Forename(s): Walter

Place of Birth: Hornby, Yorkshire

Service No: G/9148

Rank: Private

Regiment / Corps / Service: Queen’s (Royal West Surrey Regiment)

Battalion / Unit: 2nd Battalion

Division: 7th Division

Age: ---

Date of Death: 1916-12-12

Awards: ---

CWGC Grave / Memorial Reference: B. 18.

CWGC Cemetery: BEAUMONT-HAMEL BRITISH CEMETERY

CWGC Memorial: ---

Non-CWGC Burial: ---

Local War Memorial: SKIPTON, YORKSHIRE

Additional Information:

Walter Turner was the son of John and Alison Turner, née McIntosh. John, who at one time worked as a clog maker, was born at Slaidburn, Yorkshire (the son of Christopher and Jane Turner); Alice was born at Edinburgh, Midlothian, Scotland. In 1871 John, Alice and their children were living at Howlsike, Glaisdale, Yorkshire.

1881 Edinburgh, Midlothian Census: 162, Pleasance - Walter Turner, aged 3 years, born Yorkshire. [Walter and two sisters, Annie and Alice, along with their mother Alice, were visiting George (born Edinburgh 1831) and Ann Ewart (born Kent 1834) who were probably relatives The rest of the Turner family were living at 9, Chaloner Street, Guisborough, Yorkshire.]

1891 Armathwaite Township, Cumberland: Firth Inn - Walter Turner, aged 13 years, born, Hunslet, Leeds, Yorkshire, son of John and Alison Turner.

1911 Eyke, Suffolk Census: Woodbridge - Walter Turner, clog maker, aged 32 years, born Robin Hoods Bay, Yorkshire. [Walter and his brother Joseph, who was born at Slaidburn, Yorkshire, were living with Harry and Ann Collins.]

The British Army Service Record for Walter Turner exists but may be incomplete. In this record it is stated that his mother, Alison, aged 83 years (in 1919), was living at 2, Court Lane, Skipton, Yorkshire. A daughter of Walter, Gladys Grimwood, born 12 August 1913 is also named and her address is given as c/o Mrs. Smith, Church Terrace, Wickham Market, Suffolk.

British Army WW1 Medal Rolls Index Cards: Pte Walter Turner, G/9148, The Queens R.

British Army WW1 Medal and Award Rolls: Pte Walter Turner, G/9148, 1st [sic] R.W.S.

Army Registers of Soldiers' Effects: Pte Walter Turner, G/9148, 2nd Bn Royal W. Surrey Regt. Date and Place of Death: 12.12.16. France. To whom Authorised/Amount Authorised: Mother and sole legatee: Alison. £5 11s. 2d.

UK, WW1 Pension Ledgers and Index Cards, 1914-1923: card(s) exist for Walter.

Data Source: Craven’s Part in the Great War - original CPGW book entry

View Entry in CPGW Book

Entry in West Yorkshire Pioneer Illustrated War Record:

TURNER, Walter, 12th December, 1916. [Additional]

---
